Comments: 0x00 - Very Easy (1 coin required)
Same as above.
Same as above, but all five values in this offset are "0A".

Effect: START of Per Character Action State Table
Comments: Indexed by Internal Character ID

Effect: Per Character Neutral Special Action Initalization Table
Comments: Indexed by Internal Character ID

Effect: START of Shared Action State Function Table
Comments: See Action State Reference
Loaded from DOL.See the "Modifying Default Settings" DOL mod section for information on the variable list: http://smashboards.com/threads/the-dol-mod-topic.326347/
0x08010000 = 8 minutes, pause off. 0x08000100 = 8 minutes, pause on

Effect: Ready to fight banner visiblity status
Stamina Mode Narrarator Sound FX ID
Comments: Other Special Melee Sound FX ID's are located around here
0x00 - Team (0x00 = Red 0x01 = Blue 0x02 = Green)
0x01 - Player Mode (0x00 = Human 0x01 = CPU 0x02 = Demo? 0x03 = Disabled)
4 Bytes - Example: Reading 4 bytes at address 0x803F0E08 returns 0x00010A0A
0x02 - Costume ID
Byte 2 is costume ID (goes from 0x00 to 0x03 or however many costumes a character has), so the example means player 1 has Fox's orange costume since 0x01 is the associated ID.
0x03 - Last VALID selected/hovered character ID (0x00 to 0x18)
Byte 3 and 4 indicate the character ID. Unsure if they're ever different. 0x00 is Dr. mario and 0x18 is Roy (Roster ordering). Therefore, the example means player 1 is Fox since 0x0A is Fox's ID.

Effect: Start of Item Action Function Table
Comments: Indexed by Item ID. See Entity Data Offsets for info.
These all seem to be addresses within a function, rather than a pointer to the start of the function.
0x80000000 = on. Increment word by 1 to advance frame by frame. 00000000 = unpause
Defaults at 0xA4CB8. Cut it in half for double speed (0x5265C).
See Entity Data Offsets for notes
0x00 of P1's static Player Block data. Each player is 0xE90 apart (goes up to Player 6).
Refer to the Char Offset table. Each subsequent player's pointer is stored at 0xE90
See above for variable list.
0 = locked, 1 = unlocked. Characters are in order of their external values excluding starters, from Mr. Game & Watch in the LSB to Ganondorf in 10
0 = locked, 1 = unlocked. Stages are in a unique order
Doesn't actually affect the music/sound volume when changed, but if changed outside of sound menu the slider will appear at the newly inputted position upon next sound menu entry
If it is greater than 0x4B0, it rains bombs (likely num frames of current match).
Ex. 000001E0 = 8 minutes (1E0=decimal 480[seconds] = 8 minutes)
Counts up every frame to subtract from timer. Write 0 to this every frame to freeze timer.
Change to anything greater than 00 to immediately start bomb rain during a match (has to be at least 20 seconds after match starts for bombs to drop)
@ +0x08 = Item Switch values
These appear to reset to 0 whenever an input is received.
counts up 1 every frame until another input is sent, or it hits 0x64 (100 frames). Also resets on menu transition - Absolome
These are spaced 0x30 apart
00 = Current major; 01 = Pending major; 02 = Previous major; 03 = Current minor
0x10000000 = paused
Disable game functions from processing each frame. Each bit is a flag for a different function.
01 = on, 00 = off (free for all)
Uses External ID

Effect: Has Something to do with above address
